main event: A circular shaped silver gold colored object was observed visually by ground and aircrew in Yakima, Washington, on 12 October 1953.
interesting points: The object was observed at an approximate altitude of 45,000 feet and displayed no movement during the observation., The sighting lasted for about 30 minutes., The observation was made under high thin scattered clouds., Both the ground and aircrew reported the sighting simultaneously., The object was concluded to be a meteorological phenomenon, likely a balloon.
sighted object: circular shaped silver gold colored object
witness description: ground observers and aircrew from an aircraft
